commit_message:
Neutron support for aggregated rate limiting

Implements: blueprint aggregated-rate-limiting-qos

Change-Id: Ie69a70776c625b2ac10fae257ffbbcd4fc4c92c3
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/16/259916/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== QoS Aggregated Bandwidth Rate Limiting ====================================== launchpad RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1521194 In some cases Openstack operators may want to configure QoS bandwidth rate limit for overall network. Think about a case where different users having different resources has different bandwidth consumption/s. This specification talk about how this usecase can be achieved with some changes to the existing QoS bandwidth rate limit functionality [1]_. Problem Description =================== Currently when a cloud operator configures QoS bandwidth rate limit for a network, the same is applied to all the ports in the network. This behaviour could be misleading. Let's try to understand the issue with an example: * Administrator configures QoS bandwidth rate limit of 100Mbps for the user's network. * User spawn 10 VMs connected to his network. * Each VM in the network gets 100Mbps bandwidth limit and the overall allowed limit for the network becomes 1Gbps instead of 100Mbps. This behaviour is inconsistent and confusing to the administrators as the policy applied to the network is not applied at the network level but applied to all the ports available in the network. Proposed Change =============== QoS bandwidth rate limit policy applied to a network should be equally applied to all the ports connected to the network. For example: * Administrator configures QoS bandwidth rate limit of 100Mbps for a user network. * User spawn 10 VMs connected to his network. * Each VM in the network gets 10Mbps bandwidth limit so overall traffic becomes 100Mbps. * If the user spins another 10 VMs then the bandwidth rate is adjusted to 5Mbps. * If the user want more bandwidth for a particular VM then he need to apply QoS policy directly at the port level. Data Model Impact ----------------- None Future work beyond this spec ---------------------------- There could be more intelligent approach where a port over or under utillization can be measured and bandwidth can be applied as per the usage. This needs more thought. REST API Impact --------------- Proposed change will not require changes at API level because QoS service plugin already support policy applicability at network and port level. It shouldn't also require changes on L2 agent's extension side because notifications about updated bandwidth limits are already send to agents and agents are able to handle such notifications. Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- N/A Other End User Impact --------------------- N/A Performance Impact ------------------ N/A IPv6 Impact ----------- N/A Developer Impact ---------------- N/A Community Impact ---------------- This change shouldn't impact the community in any major way as the existing API remains unchanged. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Slawek Kaplonski <https://launchpad.net/~slaweq> Secondary assignee: Vikram Choudhary <https://launchpad.net/~vikschw> Work Items ---------- * Modify existing behaviour while for appliying QoS bandwidth limit rule. * Add Unit tests to the Neutron server. * Add API tests. Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- N/A. API tests should be sufficient. Functional Tests ---------------- Relevant functional tests will be added. API Tests --------- * Make sure network qos policies is evenly applied on all the ports. Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ Behaviour change will be documented as specified in this document. References ========== .. [1] Neutron QoS API Models and Extension https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/liberty/qos-api-extension.html

commit_message:
Adding bootstrapping rebuilding to test_review_in_fuel_agent

Adding gates_test/helpers/utils patch_bootstrap methods
to rebuild centos and ubuntu bootstraps to use new code
from fuel-agent review.
Methods for CentOS bootstrap commented and unused.

Change-Id: I8cc601dfa53f71b4e1d78814ce451ea9d98940e9
Closes-Bug: #1519880
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/83/254683/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def patch_bootstrap(environment): logger.info("Update fuel-agent code and assemble new bootstrap") if not settings.UPDATE_FUEL: raise Exception("{} variable don't exist" .format(settings.UPDATE_FUEL)) try: pack_path = '/var/www/nailgun/fuel-agent-review/' with environment.d_env.get_admin_remote() as remote: remote.upload(settings.UPDATE_FUEL_PATH.rstrip('/'), pack_path) # renew code in bootstrap # Step 1 - unpack bootstrap bootstrap_var = "/var/initramfs" bootstrap = "/var/www/nailgun/bootstrap" cmd = ("mkdir {0};" "cp /{1}/initramfs.img {0}/;" "cd {0};" "cat initramfs.img | gunzip | cpio -imudv;").format( bootstrap_var, bootstrap ) with environment.d_env.get_admin_remote() as remote: result = remote.execute(cmd) assert_equal(result['exit_code'], 0, ('Failed to add unpack bootstrap {}' ).format(result)) # Step 2 - replace fuel-agent code in unpacked bootstrap agent_path = "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/fuel_agent" image_rebuild = "{} | {} | {}".format( "find . -xdev", "cpio --create --format='newc'", "gzip -9 > /var/initramfs/initramfs.img.updated") cmd = ("rm -rf {0}{1}/*;" "rm -rf {0}/initramfs.img" "cp -r {2}fuel-agent/fuel_agent/* {0}{1}/;" "cd {0}/;" "{3};" ).format( bootstrap_var, agent_path, pack_path, image_rebuild) with environment.d_env.get_admin_remote() as remote: result = remote.execute(cmd) assert_equal(result['exit_code'], 0, ('Failed to add rebuild bootstrap {}' ).format(result)) except Exception as e: logger.error("Could not upload package {e}".format(e=e)) raise def replace_bootstrap(environment): """Replaced initramfs.img in /var/www/nailgun/ with re-builded with review code environment - Environment Model object - self.env """ rebuilded_bootstrap = '/var/initramfs/' .format(rebuilded_bootstrap)) ).format(bootstrap, rebuilded_bootstrap) '{0}initramfs.img.updated'.format(rebuilded_bootstrap))
deleted_lines: def replace_bootstrap(environment): pack_path = '/var/www/nailgun/fuel-agent/' with environment.d_env.get_admin_remote() as remote: remote.upload(settings.UPDATE_FUEL_PATH.rstrip('/'), pack_path) .format(pack_path)) ).format(bootstrap, pack_path) '{0}initramfs.img.updated'.format(pack_path))

commit_message:
Add ZTE Block Storage Driver for ZTE ZXCLOUD Storage arrays with iSCSI.

It will support the minimum set of features required in Icehouse:
 * Volume Create/Delete
 * Volume Attach/Detach
 * Snapshot Create/Delete
 * Create Volume from Snapshot
 * Copy Image to Volume
 * Copy Volume to Image
 * Clone Volume
 * Extend Volume
DocImpact
Implements: bp zte-cinder-driver

Change-Id: I82ad9242f7c9fc8e9e85ee139d4b4517036ac9dd

commit_message:
Use imageutils from oslo.utils

We clean up oslo-incubator in 90ae25e38915cc502d9e9c52d59e8fb668a72ae1,
and sync imageutils to oslo.utis with unittest in version 3.1.
openstack/common/imageutils.py exists without unittest. Let's switch
to use oslo.utils' imageutils.

Change-Id: I0adf2c23b1e5a5ab6274a6aa53ed46720e3aa05e

commit_message:
Disable capabilities based on 3PAR licenses

The 3PAR firmware is now reporting which licenses are enabled on the
storage array. The 3PAR drivers will now use this information to
enable/disable standard stat reporting for thin provisioning,
QoS support and replication

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint 3par-license-check
Change-Id: Ib5fb06b1c029d026f6f38fa3fdf7d62c2005c06e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/28/258728/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3.0.7 - Enable standard capabilities based on 3PAR licenses VERSION = "3.0.7" # License values for reported capabilities PRIORITY_OPT_LIC = "Priority Optimization" THIN_PROV_LIC = "Thin Provisioning" REMOTE_COPY_LIC = "Remote Copy" qos_support = True thin_support = True remotecopy_support = True if 'licenseInfo' in info: if 'licenses' in info['licenseInfo']: self.valid_licenses = info['licenseInfo']['licenses'] qos_support = self._check_license_enabled( self.valid_licenses, self.PRIORITY_OPT_LIC, "QoS_support") thin_support = self._check_license_enabled( self.valid_licenses, self.THIN_PROV_LIC, "Thin_provisioning_support") remotecopy_support = self._check_license_enabled( self.valid_licenses, self.REMOTE_COPY_LIC, "Replication") 'QoS_support': qos_support, 'thin_provisioning_support': thin_support, if (hpe3parclient.version >= MIN_REP_CLIENT_VERSION and remotecopy_support): def _check_license_enabled(self, valid_licenses, license_to_check, capability): """check a license against valid licenses on the array.""" if self.valid_licenses: for license in self.valid_licenses: if license_to_check in license.get('name'): return True LOG.debug(("'%(capability)s' requires a '%(license)s' " "license which is not installed.") % {'capability': capability, 'license': license_to_check}) return False
deleted_lines: VERSION = "3.0.6" 'QoS_support': True, 'thin_provisioning_support': True, if hpe3parclient.version >= MIN_REP_CLIENT_VERSION:

commit_message:
Removing Cue client instantiation from Rally test

Since Cue client support is being added in Rally, instantiation
from Cue's Rally test implementation is not needed anymore.

see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255606/

Change-Id: I84c2800a4e46c882822b87b7e078307550e50e5b

commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix netwrap to support security group

This implementation is to give support on neutron security group with
XenServer as compute driver. When using openvswitch, the ovs agent on
compute node cannot execute some linux commands correctly due to
xenserver driver lacking of such support. This change will add some
allowed commands which can be executed in dom0.

Implements: blueprint xenserver-give-support-on-neutron-security-group

Change-Id: I377f8ad51e1d2725c3e0153e64322055fcce7b54

subject: Force L3 agent to resync router it could not configure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-19 19:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/822ad5f06bcef8f95f36032d4fd4709975cecc31', 'message': 'Force L3 agent to resync router it could not configure

If the L3 agent fails to configure a router, commit:
4957b5b43521a61873a041fe3e8989ed399903d9 changed it so
that instead of performing an expensive full sync, only that
router is reconfigured. However, it tries to reconfigure the
cached router. This is a change of behavior from the fullsync
days. The retry is more likely to succeed if the
router is retrieved from the server, instead of using
the locally cached version, in case the user or operator
fixed bad input, or if the router was retrieved in a bad
state due to a server-side race condition.

Note that this is only relevant to full syncs, as those retrieve
routers from the server and queue updates with the router object.
Incremental updates queue up updates without router objects,
so if one of those fails it would always be resynced on a
second attempt.

Related-Bug: #1494682
Change-Id: Id0565e11b3023a639589f2734488029f194e2f9d
'}]
commit_message:
Force L3 agent to resync router it could not configure

If the L3 agent fails to configure a router, commit:
4957b5b43521a61873a041fe3e8989ed399903d9 changed it so
that instead of performing an expensive full sync, only that
router is reconfigured. However, it tries to reconfigure the
cached router. This is a change of behavior from the fullsync
days. The retry is more likely to succeed if the
router is retrieved from the server, instead of using
the locally cached version, in case the user or operator
fixed bad input, or if the router was retrieved in a bad
state due to a server-side race condition.

Note that this is only relevant to full syncs, as those retrieve
routers from the server and queue updates with the router object.
Incremental updates queue up updates without router objects,
so if one of those fails it would always be resynced on a
second attempt.

Related-Bug: #1494682
Change-Id: Id0565e11b3023a639589f2734488029f194e2f9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/259708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import timeutilsfrom neutron.agent.l3 import router_processing_queue def test_process_routers_update_resyncs_failed_router(self): agent = l3_agent.L3NATAgent(HOSTNAME, self.conf) # Attempting to configure the router will fail agent._process_router_if_compatible = mock.MagicMock() agent._process_router_if_compatible.side_effect = RuntimeError() # Queue an update from a full sync update = router_processing_queue.RouterUpdate( 42, router_processing_queue.PRIORITY_SYNC_ROUTERS_TASK, router=mock.Mock(), timestamp=timeutils.utcnow()) agent._queue.add(update) agent._process_router_update() # The update contained the router object, get_routers won't be called self.assertFalse(agent.plugin_rpc.get_routers.called) # The update failed, assert that get_routers was called agent._process_router_update() self.assertTrue(agent.plugin_rpc.get_routers.called)

commit_message:
Support RackConnect V3 LB in Rackspace AutoScaleGroup Resource

Currently, only Rackspace CloudLoadBalancers are supported by
the ASG resource.

Also update the requirements to use fork of pyrax that is
maintained by the Rackspace heat team.

Closes-Bug: #1525391
Change-Id: Iabb52b2a34f1c2a434e724b9a70e4b948e4d0d37

commit_message:
Update the cache middleware flavor guideline.

The description of cache middleware flavor in the configuring doc
should be updated.

Change-Id: I6bf6083b01e4e5e3402817279ed367fbfb4cf42e
Closes-bug: #1479116
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/17/254517/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``cache`` flavor in your api config file. There are there types you can chose.:: flavor = <cachemanagement|keystone+cachemanagement|trusted-auth+cachemanagement>
deleted_lines: ``cache`` flavor in your api config file. flavor = cachemanage

commit_message:
Enable name property update for os.nova.server profile

This patch adds supports of updating name property for os.nova.server
profile type.

Change-Id: If67560bb47f378b0ce19898490de0416f6ac04aa
Partially-implement: blueprint support-nova-server-update
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/92/260392/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_do_update_name_to_given_string_succeeded(self): obj = mock.Mock() obj.physical_id = 'FAKE_ID' novaclient = mock.Mock() profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = novaclient new_spec = copy.deepcopy(self.spec) new_spec['properties']['name'] = 'TEST_SERVER' new_profile = server.ServerProfile('t', new_spec) res = profile.do_update(obj, new_profile) self.assertTrue(res) novaclient.server_update.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', name='TEST_SERVER') def test_do_update_name_to_none_succeeded(self): obj = mock.Mock() obj.physical_id = 'FAKE_ID' obj.name = 'FAKE_OBJ_NAME' novaclient = mock.Mock() profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = novaclient new_spec = copy.deepcopy(self.spec) del new_spec['properties']['name'] # name property is removed new_profile = server.ServerProfile('t', new_spec) res = profile.do_update(obj, new_profile) self.assertTrue(res) novaclient.server_update.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', name='FAKE_OBJ_NAME') def test_do_update_name_failed(self): ex = exception.InternalError(code=500, message='Internal server error') novaclient = mock.Mock() novaclient.server_update.side_effect = ex obj = mock.Mock() obj.physical_id = 'FAKE_ID' profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = novaclient new_spec = copy.deepcopy(self.spec) new_spec['properties']['name'] = 'TEST_SERVER' new_profile = server.ServerProfile('t', new_spec) res = profile.do_update(obj, new_profile) self.assertFalse(res) novaclient.server_update.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', name='TEST_SERVER')
